entry.title: A Small Modification to Segwit
entry.summary: In an email thread on the Bitcoin-dev mailing list, Jimmy Song questioned why end users of Bitcoin would want to change its policy to make their money more vulnerable to a 51% attack. Song argues that while one company may have an advantage by using extra nonce space, the use of ASICBoosted hash rate will help secure the network against newer optimizations in the future. There is no further context provided in the email.
